Environment Creation

We provide an environment file called circadipy_env.yml that contains all the dependencies required to run circadipy. To create a new environment using this file, you will need to use the newly installed mambaforge terminal. To create the environment, you can follow these steps:

  1. Open the mambaforge terminal.

  2. Navigate to the folder where you downloaded the circadipy_env.yml file:

    • You can use the cd command to navigate to the folder.

    • E.g.:

      (base) $ cd "C:\Users\user\Downloads"

  3. Run the following command:

    (base) $ mamba env create -f circadipy_env.yml

  4. Wait for the environment to be created:

    • This can take a few minutes.

    • In the case of conda, the environment creation can take a significant amount of time because of the environment solving process. This process is usually faster with mamba.

  5. Activate the environment using the following command:

    (base) $ mamba activate circadipy_env

  6. Then the terminal should look something like this:

    (circadipy_env) $
